1.text: Then Jonah prayed to the LORD his God out of the fishâ€™s belly,

2.text: And said, I cried by reason of my affliction to the LORD, and he heard me; out of the belly of hell cried I, and you heard my voice.

3.text: For you had cast me into the deep, in the middle of the seas; and the floods compassed me about: all your billows and your waves passed over me.

4.text: Then I said, I am cast out of your sight; yet I will look again toward your holy temple.

5.text: The waters compassed me about, even to the soul: the depth closed me round about, the weeds were wrapped about my head.

6.text: I went down to the bottoms of the mountains; the earth with her bars was about me for ever: yet have you brought up my life from corruption, O LORD my God.

7.text: When my soul fainted within me I remembered the LORD: and my prayer came in to you, into your holy temple.

8.text: They that observe lying vanities forsake their own mercy.

9.text: But I will sacrifice to you with the voice of thanksgiving; I will pay that that I have vowed. Salvation is of the LORD.

10.text: And the LORD spoke to the fish, and it vomited out Jonah on the dry land.
